Scenario.name: simplest
Scenario.description: This is the simplest DKF that can be used by most training applications. It only contains 1 condition, the Application Completed Condition, which when triggered will end the domain assessment and therefore the Training Application course element.

concept.name: Trigger Location for Arrows Flickering on Incorrect Path

pointRef.value: Begin Arrow Flickering on Wrong Path Trigger

point.name: Begin Arrow Flickering on Wrong Path Trigger

stateTransition.name: Team Members are Awaiting Assignment Instructions

strategyRef.name: Message to White Cell - Open Gate
Message to White Cell - Transport Vehicles for Shorter Demo

stateTransition.name: Vehicles Have Reached Cyber Bullet at Compromised Location

strategyRef.name: Cyber Bullet Attack Alert and Vehicle Transportation

stateTransition.name: Team Chose to Follow GPS Guidance

performanceNode.name: Trigger Location for Arrows Flickering on Incorrect Path

strategyRef.name: All Compromised Arrows Flicker after Interpreter Conversation Begins

ns4:message.ns4:content: Mission initializing...
From the VBS main menu, go to Networking. Select the appropriate Host and click Join.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-A-5 (A1). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-A-4 (B1). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-A-6 (B2). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-B-2 (C2). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-A-8 (B4). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-A-9 (C1). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as BLUFOR actor named 1-1-B-1 (A2). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) to continue.
You will be playing as Independent actor named 1-1-A-2 (White_Cell). Click 'OK' on the right hand side (in VBS) after all other players have selected their roles.
Your assigned vehicle is Vehicle 1 (V1).
Your assigned vehicle is Vehicle 2 (V2).
You will be the driver of Vehicle 1 (V1).
You will be the driver of Vehicle 2 (V2).

strategy.name: Message to White Cell - Open Gate

ns4:message.ns4:content: Open the FOB Gate!!
You are now going to be transported.

ns4:scenarioAdaptation.ns4:description: Transport V1 Closer to Weapons Cache Block
Transport V2 Closer to Weapons Cache Block

ns4:message.ns4:content: The White Cell has just transported you closer to your objective location. Please proceed.

strategy.name: Message to White Cell - Transport Vehicles for Shorter Demo

ns4:message.ns4:content: If you'd like to shorten the time spent in this scenario, now would be a good time to transport the players!
Your team has successfully exited the FOB.
Now, follow your GPS provided arrows to locate the weapons cache.
You are going too fast! Slow down!!
You are going too fast! Slow down!!
You are too far away from the lead vehicle.

ns4:scenarioAdaptation.ns4:description: Flicker Additional Arrow with First Compromised GPS Arrow
Flicker Additional Arrow with Second Compromised GPS Arrow

ns4:message.ns4:content: Now is a great opportunity to have a conversation about the Compromised GPS!
If the squad decides not to trust the GPS, you can remove the GPS arrows from the scenario using the "Remove GPS Arrows" strategy.

strategy.name: All Compromised Arrows Flicker after Interpreter Conversation Begins

ns4:scenarioAdaptation.ns4:description: Flicker Arrow on Compromised GPS Path
Flicker Arrow on Compromised GPS Path
Flicker Arrow on Compromised GPS Path

strategy.name: Cyber Bullet Attack Alert and Vehicle Transportation

ns4:message.ns4:content: YOU'VE JUST BEEN HIT WITH A CYBER BULLET! You will now be transported back to the intersection where you made the mistake of not trusting the Interpreter.

ns4:scenarioAdaptation.ns4:description: Transport V1 to Correct Path to Weapons Cache
Transport V2 to Correct Path to Weapons Cache

ns4:message.ns4:content:
Remember: technology cannot always be trusted. If you see warning signs of a possible GPS compromise, always try to gather as much information about the path you are taking to ensure it is the correct path and not an attempted ambush or attack, especially when you are in enemy territory.
Now, continue on and follow the directions provided by your interpreter to the weapons cache.
You have successfully reached the weapons cache. Don't forget to secure the outside perimeter while the other team secures the weapons.
You have successfully reached the weapons cache. Don't forget to send a SPOT report after you've secured the weapons inside.
To send a SPOT report when you secure the weapons: click the center mouse button, then in the GIFT window click on the 'Learner Actions' tab and select 'SEND SPOT REPORT'.
